availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Marshall County, Kentucky, farmer. Tennessee native. Married Nancy Jane Petty Quarles. Father of Lanora Isodore Quarles, Ralph Petty Quarles, Kansas Alva Quarles, and Mary Alice Quarles. Farmer in Marshall County in 1860.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marshall County, Barksdale post office, p. 34; Find A Grave, "James Monroe Quarles (1825 - 1906)," Memorial #67667197, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=67667197 (accessed July 9, 2017).
